items.from_string:
Title: Create image attachment pipeline in harness

Value Statement:
As a Mlops developer supporting CI/CD migrating to Harness, I need to migrate the mlkit image attachment pipeline to harness so that I can attach images to sagemaker domains in order to cut new mlkit releases with Harness.

AC:
Pipeline for mlkit image attachment to sagemaker domains is recreated in harness and tested
Template for the mlkit image attachment pipeline is created for reuse in unified mlkit pipeline
items.to_string: Value Statement: As a BIP AI Tenant, I want a Harness trigger that detects changes in Git (specific branch/file in the SPA-Agentic repo) and automatically runs our pipeline that builds the container image and deploys the Lambda function, so that deployments happen consistently and automatically whenever a change is merged/committed, reducing manual steps and ensuring environments stay in sync with Git AC: When a user makes a PR in a specific branch for a specific file in the the SPA Agentic Repo, the user has the ability to automatically kick off the tenant-agnostic pipeline in Harness (and have it succeed) w/ the SPA-Agentic lambda input set This can be verified in the execution history of the tenant-agnostic pipeline and of the trigger itself. Also will require going into the AWS Console to see if the lambda updates there Misc Note(s): Potential future work could include creating lambdas automatically and testing the lambda's functionality

items.from_string: Value Statement: As a BIP AI Tenant, I want a Harness trigger that detects changes in Git (specific branch/file in the SPA-Agentic repo) and automatically runs our pipeline that builds the container image and deploys the Lambda function, so that deployments happen consistently and automatically whenever a change is merged/committed, reducing manual steps and ensuring environments stay in sync with Git AC: When a user makes a PR in a specific branch for a specific file in the the SPA Agentic Repo, the user has the ability to automatically kick off the tenant-agnostic pipeline in Harness (and have it succeed) w/ the SPA-Agentic lambda input set This can be verified in the execution history of the tenant-agnostic pipeline and of the trigger itself. Also will require going into the AWS Console to see if the lambda updates there Misc Note(s): Potential future work could include creating lambdas automatically and testing the lambda's functionality
items.to_string:
Value Statement: As a BIP AI Tenant, I want a Harness trigger that detects changes in Git (specific branch/file in the SPA-Agentic repo) and automatically runs our pipeline that builds the container image and deploys the Lambda function, so that deployments happen consistently and automatically whenever a change is merged/committed, reducing manual steps and ensuring environments stay in sync with Git 

AC: When a user makes a PR in a specific branch for a specific file in the the SPA Agentic Repo, the user has the ability to automatically kick off the tenant-agnostic pipeline in Harness (and have it succeed) w/ the SPA-Agentic lambda input set This can be verified in the execution history of the tenant-agnostic pipeline and of the trigger itself. Also will require going into the AWS Console to see if the lambda updates there 

Misc Note(s): Potential future work could include creating lambdas automatically and testing the lambda's functionality

Identify repositories requiring migration to GitHub Enterprise Cloud for comprehensive migration planning **Value Statement** As a BIP AI DevOps engineer who manages platform infrastructure and code repositories, I need the ability to identify and catalog all repositories that need to migrate to GitHub Enterprise Cloud so that I can develop accurate migration timelines, assess risks, and ensure no critical repositories are overlooked during the platform transition. **Acceptance Criteria** When a user completes the repository identification process, the user has the ability to access a comprehensive inventory of all repositories with migration assessments and prioritization recommendations. * **Functionality that will validate that this story is complete** * Complete inventory of all current BIP AI repositories across existing platforms (GitHub.com, internal Git servers, other SCM tools) * Repository categorization by type (infrastructure, tenant code, documentation, archived projects) * Migration complexity assessment for each repository (dependencies, integrations, CI/CD pipelines) * Repository ownership and stakeholder identification for each codebase * Security classification and access requirements documentation * Migration priority ranking based on business criticality and technical dependencies * Integration dependencies mapping (CI/CD pipelines, webhooks, third-party tools) * **Documentation is updated** in Confluence with: * Repository migration inventory spreadsheet with all identified repositories * Migration complexity and risk assessment matrix * Repository ownership and contact information **Assumptions** * Access to all current repository platforms and administrative permissions will be provided * Repository owners and stakeholders will be available for consultation during the assessment * Current CI/CD and integration configurations can be reviewed and documented **Dependencies** This Story is dependent on the completion of: GitHub Enterprise Cloud provisioning and access setup **Notes** Per our conversations with the platform team, the following information may be useful: * BIP AI currently uses multiple repository platforms and needs consolidation * Some repositories may contain legacy code or archived projects that may not require migration * Critical production repositories should be prioritized for early migration phases * Consider tenant repositories vs infrastructure repositories for different migration approaches * Some repositories may have complex CI/CD integrations that require careful planning * Security and compliance requirements may affect migration sequencing **Out of Scope** * Actual repository migration execution (separate implementation stories) * New repository structure design or reorganization * CI/CD pipeline redesign or optimization * Repository cleanup or archival decisions (assessment only) * GitHub Enterprise Cloud configuration or setup * Team training or change management activities

Title: Preprod: Custom Logger Lambda for multi-tenant telemetry in IaC Value Statement: As a BIP-AI engineer who manages centralized logging for Bedrock services, I need the ability to deploy a router Lambda in preprod that filters logs by tenant and routes them to tenant-specific log groups, so that each tenant can access only their own logs while maintaining a single ingestion point. Acceptance Criteria: - In Preprod, when platform logs are written to the central Bedrock log group, the custom Lambda filters log events by tenant and routes them to the correct tenant-specific log group. - The Lambda is deployed as an IaC resource using Crossplane with appropriate permissions to write to tenant log groups using the tenant’s execution role. - Documentation is updated to reflect the deployment structure and tenant access model for CloudWatch log groups.

items.from_string: Fix AWS Certificate Issue in Image Builder Pipeline
items.to_string:
As a platform/DevOps engineer I want to fix the AWS certificate (trust/CA) issue affecting the delegate in the image builder pipeline So that the delegate can successfully authenticate and push built images to Amazon ECR.
In the Harness pipeline run step that performs AWS/ECR actions, the pipeline exports: export AWS_CA_BUNDLE=/etc/ssl/certs/Amazon_Root_CA_1.pem The export occurs before any AWS CLI / ECR login / image push commands execute.
With the export in place, the pipeline can successfully: authenticate to ECR, and push the built image to the target ECR repository No TLS/certificate validation errors occur during auth or push.

Value Statement: As a SE for the ratings sum team, I need to promote the notifications for stuck batch inference jobs that exist in dev up to stage so that the team is notified on stuck batch inference jobs in the stage environment Acceptance Criteria: - Existing notifications that exist in dev promoted to stage - Tested by kicking off one batch inference job

Title: Update Grafana dashboards and alerts in PPD to reflect image-based Lambda deployment Value Statement: As an SE who monitors SPA-C services, I need the ability to update Grafana dashboards and alert rules in the PPD environment after the Lambda packaging change (ZIP to container image) so that monitoring remains accurate. Acceptance Criteria When a user opens the PPD Grafana dashboards for the SPA-C Lambdas, the user has the ability to see current, accurate metrics for the new image-based Lambda functions (not the retired ZIP-based functions)

Title: Create bedrock agent dashboard for MLops usage: Value Statement: As a Bip-ai engineer I need to create a new dashboard for MLOps so that we are able to view tenant agents to track and monitor their status. AC: -Create panels in MLops showing agents by tenant -Identify other key metrics that can be used and added to help gain more insight into tenant agents.

Title: Remake AI team API Metrics Grafana dashboard

### Value Statement As a platform engineer monitoring system health and performance, I need a unified Grafana dashboard that displays API metrics from all AI team microservices so that I can quickly identify issues, track performance trends, and ensure service reliability across the platform.

### Acceptance Criteria When a user views the AI team API Metrics Grafana dashboard, the dashboard displays comprehensive metrics from all AI team microservices with proper visualization and alerting capabilities. - Dashboard pulls metrics data from gateway microservice and mfes - Dashboard pulls metrics data from crossplane-manager microservice - Dashboard pulls metrics data from mlops-manager microservice - API request rates, latencies, and error rates are visualized for each service - HTTP status code distributions are displayed per service - Resource utilization metrics (CPU, memory, connections) are included - Dashboard includes appropriate time range selectors and refresh intervals - Panels are organized logically by service and metric type - Alerts are configured for critical thresholds (high error rates, elevated latencies) - Dashboard is deployed to all environments (dev, sbx, stage, preprod) - Documentation includes dashboard usage guide and metric definitions
This issue is cloned by BIP-30033

items.from_string: Title: Record end‑to‑end Harness demo: image build through Lambda deployment
items.to_string:
Title: Record end‑to‑end Harness demo: image build through Lambda deployment
Value Statement: As a DevOps engineer / enablement lead, I want to record an end-to-end Harness demo that shows the image builder pipeline executing into a Lambda deployment pipeline, so that stakeholders can clearly see the full automated flow from image build to Lambda function deployment and use the recording for training, onboarding, and enablement.
Acceptance Criteria: Scenario & Flow Definition Given I am preparing the demo When I define the scenario Then: The flow must cover: code change → image build pipeline execution → output artifact/image → Lambda deployment pipeline execution using that artifact. The specific pipelines, services, and environments used in the demo are documented (names, purpose, and relationships).
This issue is cloned by BIP-29597

items.from_string: This issue is cloned by BIP-29597
Title: Integrate Image Builder Pipeline with Lambda Deployment Pipeline in Harness
items.to_string:
Title: Integrate Image Builder Pipeline with Lambda Deployment Pipeline in Harness

 
Value Statement: As a DevOps engineer, I want to be able to trigger the Image Builder pipeline from within the Lambda Deployment pipeline in Harness, so that I can automatically build the deployment image, consume its outputs, and use them in the subsequent steps of the Lambda deployment process.
 
Acceptance Criteria: Triggering Image Builder from Lambda Pipeline Given I am configuring the Lambda Deployment pipeline in Harness When I add a Run step (or equivalent) that invokes the Image Builder pipeline Then the Lambda Deployment pipeline should be able to: Trigger the Image Builder pipeline via a webhook or pipeline trigger. Pass any required parameters (e.g., commit SHA, branch name, environment, build version). Webhook / Trigger Configuration Given the Image Builder pipeline is configured in Harness When I create a webhook-trigger configuration for it Then: The trigger URL should be accessible from the Lambda Deployment pipeline run step. The trigger should start a new execution of the Image Builder pipeline. Relevant metadata (e.g., pipeline execution ID, build number) is logged and visible in execution details. Synchronous Execution & Status Handling Given the Lambda Deployment pipeline has triggered the Image Builder pipeline When the Image Builder pipeline completes Then: The Lambda Deployment pipeline should wait for the Image Builder pipeline to finish (success or failure). If the Image Builder pipeline fails, the Lambda Deployment pipeline should: Mark the step as failed. Stop further deployment steps (unless explicitly configured otherwise). If the Image Builder pipeline succeeds, the Lambda pipeline should continue to the next steps. Access to Image Builder Outputs Given the Image Builder pipeline produces outputs (e.g., image URI, tag, digest, artifact metadata, version number) When the Lambda Deployment pipeline resumes after the Image Builder pipeline completes Then: These outputs should be available as variables/expressions within the Lambda Deployment pipeline. I should be able to reference these outputs in subsequent steps (e.g., Lambda update function step, environment variables, config files). End-to-End Deployment Using Image Outputs Given a successful run of the Image Builder pipeline within the Lambda Deployment pipeline When the Lambda Deployment pipeline proceeds to its deployment steps Then: The Lambda function(s) should be updated using the newly built image or artifact reference from the Image Builder pipeline. The deployment logs should clearly show which image/tag or artifact version was deployed.

items.from_string:
Title: Reorganize and Standardize Jenkins Pipelines for bip-ai

Value Statement:
As an MLOps engineer who manages CI/CD processes, I need the ability to reorganize and standardize Jenkins pipelines so that the system is easier to maintain, understand, and scale.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Remove old or unused pipelines based on usage history and team input.
- Rename pipelines according to a consistent, documented naming convention (defined or adopted).
- View an up-to-date inventory of active Jenkins pipelines documented in Confluence.
- Navigate organized Jenkins pipelines grouped into logical folders by purpose or project.
items.to_string:
Title: Reorganize and Standardize Jenkins Pipelines for bip-ai

Value Statement:
As an MLOps engineer who manages CI/CD processes, I need the ability to reorganize and standardize Jenkins pipelines so that the system is easier to maintain, understand, and scale.

Acceptance Criteria:
 - Create a proposal canvas document that provides a detailed plan for Dev Jenkins Pipelines
 - - list which pipelines based on usage and team input can be removed or moved to an Archive folder
 - - track Tenant pipelines and ensure they organized into logical folders Update the Confluence Jenkins Usage guide to map tenants to their respective Jenkins file(s).

Value Statement:

As a MLOps engineer and the SE for SRR, I want to promote the SRR workflow—including the SageMaker pipeline and all related components—from dev to stage so that SRR can validate the full scraping, parsing, and M21 KB update process in a production-like environment

Acceptance Criteria:

A new SageMaker pipeline is created in stage mirroring the existing dev pipeline
All IAM roles, execution profiles, and policies are verified and functional
Dev AWS resources are also created in stage (ex. 2 knowledge bases, lambda function)
SRR tenants are checked to ensure they have all required privileges for accessing stage AWS resources

items.from_string: Develop Grafana Dashboard composition to automate tenant dashboard deployments
items.to_string:
**Story:** As an MLOps Engineer, I want a Crossplane composition for Grafana dashboards so that dashboard deployments are automated as part of tenant intake and reduce manual deployment overhead.

## Assumptions

- Grafana provider is available and configured in the Crossplane environment
- Dashboard JSON bodies are developed separately from this automation
- Tenant intake process exists and can incorporate new claim templates
- SBX environment is available for testing composition functionality
- Environment-specific templating requirements are limited to naming and basic configuration differences

## Acceptance Criteria

- **Given** a dashboard JSON body **when** a tenant claim is submitted with Grafana enabled **then** the dashboard deploys automatically to the tenant's Grafana instance within 5 minutes

- **Given** a tenant claim **when** the Grafana enable/disable flag is set to disabled **then** no Grafana dashboard resources are created or deployed

- **Given** the composition **when** deployed to different environments **then** automatic naming follows environment-specific conventions and templating logic applies appropriate environment configurations

- **Given** the composite resource definition **when** validated **then** it includes all required fields for dashboard deployment and follows Crossplane CRD best practices

- **Given** the claim template **when** integrated into tenant intake **then** it provides clear enable/disable options and required dashboard configuration parameters

- **Given** the composition **when** tested in SBX environment **then** both claim deployment and composition deployment complete successfully with proper resource creation

- **Given** a failed dashboard deployment **when** the composition processes the claim **then** appropriate error conditions are surfaced and the claim status reflects the failure state

## Definition of Done

- [ ] All acceptance criteria met
- [ ] Composition, CompositeResourceDefinition, and claim template developed
- [ ] Enable/disable flag functionality implemented and tested
- [ ] Automatic naming and environment-based templating implemented
- [ ] SBX environment testing completed successfully
- [ ] Documentation updated for composition usage and claim integration

items.to_string: Add gitops hook to EVA's dev branch to enable CI/CD pipeline in dev

Value statement: As an SE who supports EVA, I need to add a gitops hook to EVA's dev branch to enable the CI/CD master pipeline so that the pipeline can be run on dev resources.

AC: Gitops hook created for dev branch. EVA's master pipeline can be run on dev domain.

Title: TERA Shadow Deployment

Value Statement: As a solutions engineer I want to support TERA in getting ready for deployment by creating a shadow deployment of current code to test in prod environment.

AC: Shadow deployment for TERA completed successfully

Title: SCC: Create M21 Knowledge Base in Stage and Pre-Prod

Value Statement: As a MLOps engineer and the SE for the SCC team, I want to create M21 Knowledge Base instances in the stage and pre-prod environments so that the same content and configuration available in dev can be validated and tested across higher environments before production deployment.

Acceptance Criteria: M21 Knowledge Base instances are created in stage and pre-prod. Each instance mirrors the structure, content, and configuration of the dev M21 Knowledge Base. Data sources and ingestion pipelines are connected and verified in both environments. Environment-specific parameters (roles, ARNs, bucket paths, IDs) are correctly configured. SCC tenants are checked to ensure they have corresponding KB access privileges in stage and pre-prod. End-to-end validation confirms that stage and pre-prod knowledge bases return responses consistent with dev.
This issue is cloned by BIP-29134

User Story: As a BIP-AI infrastructure engineer, I want to implement Grafana deployment using Crossplane based on the approved architecture design, so that our AI/ML teams can provision and manage Grafana instances through Infrastructure as Code with GitOps workflows.

Acceptance Criteria: Crossplane Composition templates are created in templates/ directory supporting the approved deployment pattern (self-hosted or Grafana Cloud) Crossplane Claims are developed in claims/ directory with examples for different environments (dev, staging, production) Compositions support required data sources (Prometheus, CloudWatch, SageMaker, RDS) with secrets management integration ADFS/SSO and RBAC configurations are implemented per BIP-AI security requirements Existing MLE Grafana templates are migrated to Crossplane Composition format with documented migration path ArgoCD Application manifests are configured to deploy Grafana instances with environment-specific value overrides Repository structure and GitOps workflow (template updates → ArgoCD sync → cluster deployment) is documented in README At least one successful Grafana deployment is validated in dev environment Dependencies: Approved architecture diagram and design document from research ticket Access to existing MLE Grafana templates and deployment patterns

Value Statement: As a DevOps engineer, I want to plan the integration of Cosign into the image builder pipeline managed by Harness, So that we have a well-defined approach, requirements, and architecture before starting implementation.

AC: Analysis of the current image builder pipeline in Harness to identify integration points for Cosign. Documentation of requirements for signing container images using Cosign within the pipeline. Identification of secure secret handling mechanisms for Cosign keys in Harness (e.g., use of Harness Secrets Manager or other secret storage). Creation of an architecture diagram detailing how Cosign will be invoked during the pipeline, where artifacts/signatures will be stored, and secret management workflow. Assessment of any validation/verification steps required downstream. Summary of potential blockers or constraints (e.g., pipeline agent capabilities, registry support, compliance needs). A clear plan and checklist for the implementation phase, broken down into actionable sub-tasks.

Value Statement: As a team lead, I need to produce biweekly reports to satisfy VA requirements and ensure communication on team updates.

Working with other leads, we will ensure these reports are submitted by the expected due dates.

items.from_string:
As a BIP AI  engineer, I want to have the ability to deploy lambda functions as a zip package to make lambda deployments for flexible for tenants

AC: 
The existing lambda deployment pipeline is able to support both image and zip based deployments. Testing is completed for at least one real deployment scenario
items.to_string:
As a BIP AI  engineer, I want to create a golden set, highly templatized Harness pipeline for deploying lambda functions based on the existing lambda deployment pipeline, so that teams can quickly reuse and adapt the pipeline for different processing jobs using input sets.

AC: 
The pipeline is modular and templatized, allowing easy customization and reuse.
The pipeline is saved as a Harness template and documented for other users to pull and use.
The template supports parameterization for common deployment variables.
Pipeline is tested and validated for at least one real deployment scenario.
